channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: High Profile Endorsement Defections: Justin Long for Intel, LeBron James for PepsiCo
item.description: The backstory: Long is the latest pawn in Intel and Apple’s chip chess match. Basketball star LeBron James inked a deal with PepsiCo after working with Coca-Cola since he was 18 years old.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: March 18
item.description: Speaking at his company’s annual shareholders meeting, Samsung Co-CEO Koh Dong-jin warned that the global chip shortage will ding business performance.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Iceland Reopens to Non-EU Visitors
item.description: Previously, EU citizens could visit Iceland without quarantining, but now the country is opening up to those outside the bloc’s free-travel zone known as the Schengen area.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Snap Buys Fit Analytics to Bolster Its Fashion and E-Commerce Aspirations
item.description: Adding Fit Analytics opens the door for Snap to monetize through in-app purchases and reduce its reliance on ad dollars.  The company: Berlin-based Fit Analytics uses machine learning and customer-provided info to help shoppers find the right clothing size when ordering online.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Report: Global Gasoline Consumption Has Peaked
item.description: Ever since the Model T rolled off production lines, gasoline has been the primary fuel source to get from Point A to Point B.  One important note: The IEA does see a full recovery for global crude oil demand, which is used for everything from jet fuel to electricity generation—not just for gasoline.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Fed Boosts Economic Growth Projections, but Maintains Its Easy Money Strategy
item.description: If the Fed said things do look better, then it’s increasingly hard to justify its current strategy of ultra-loose monetary policy, which is when the Fed uses its tools (like lowering interest rates) to juice the economy when it’s in the dumps. That’s not us trying to impress our middle school readers—it’s a direct quote from the Federal Reserve’s highly anticipated policy statement yesterday.   As the US economy continues to rebound from its Covid-induced recession, the Fed projects GDP will grow 6.5% this year, a big jump from its previous estimate of 4.2% in December.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Snap Buys Fit Analytics to Bolster Its Fashion and E-Commerce Aspirations
item.description: Adding Fit Analytics opens the door for Snap to monetize through in-app purchases and reduce its reliance on ad dollars.  The company: Berlin-based Fit Analytics uses machine learning and customer-provided info to help shoppers find the right clothing size when ordering online.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: High Profile Endorsement Defections: Justin Long for Intel, LeBron James for PepsiCo
item.description: The backstory: Long is the latest pawn in Intel and Apple’s chip chess match. LeBron will be the face of Pepsi’s new morning energy drink, plus he will promote some of its other brands, and take part in the company’s social justice efforts. Now it is.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Iceland Reopens to Non-EU Visitors
item.description: Previously, EU citizens could visit Iceland without quarantining, but now the country is opening up to those outside the bloc’s free-travel zone known as the Schengen area.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: March 18
item.description: (Shaan Puri on Twitter) Read: Why Clubhouse will fail. Koh said that Samsung may even skip the introductions of its new Galaxy Note phone because of the lack of chips.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Fed Boosts Economic Growth Projections, but Maintains Its Easy Money Strategy
item.description: If the Fed said things do look better, then it’s increasingly hard to justify its current strategy of ultra-loose monetary policy, which is when the Fed uses its tools (like lowering interest rates) to juice the economy when it’s in the dumps. That’s not us trying to impress our middle school readers—it’s a direct quote from the Federal Reserve’s highly anticipated policy statement yesterday.   As the US economy continues to rebound from its Covid-induced recession, the Fed projects GDP will grow 6.5% this year, a big jump from its previous estimate of 4.2% in December.

item.title: 5 Ways the $1.9 Trillion Stimulus Bill May Affect Your 2020 Taxes
item.description: So, here are the main ways the ARP may affect your taxes: If you are or were unemployed: The IRS won’t tax the first $10,200 of your benefits if you made less than $150,000 in 2020.  Here’s an example, per MarketWatch: “If you owe the maximum $17,075 for the 2020 Social Security tax portion of the SE tax, it works out that you can potentially defer up to half of that amount, or $8,537. ) was closed due to Covid-19loss of child care due to the pandemic  If you have kids: You’re getting a bigger tax credit thanks to a major expansion of the Child Tax Credit (CTC). ) The tax pros we spoke with are also still trying to understand whether two unemployed spouses who file jointly will get $20,400 of benefits tax-free at the federal level. Qualified family leave, per the IRS, includes periods in which you’re unable to work due to: care for a child if their school or “place of care” (summer camp, enrichment program, etc.
item.author: Devin Tomb

item.title: Why ETFs Are Exploding in Popularity
item.description: Q from Andrew: Why have I seen so many new ETFs pop up recently? Most ETFs are like SPY—they track indexes. what exactly are ETFs?  The Brew's A: ETFs, or exchange-traded funds, are investment products that give you a way to buy and sell a basket of assets without having to buy all the components individually.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: March 17
item.description: Emer Cooke, the head of the EU's drug regulator, said there is no evidence that AstraZeneca's vaccine has been causing the blood clots found in 37 people who've received the vaccine across the EU and Britain. (Vice) Read: A hacker got all my texts for $16.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: If You Work in Finance, You Might Be Back in the Office Soon
item.description: Then yesterday, we learned that JPMorgan is planning for summer interns in New York and London to work in-person. Both of those are trickier to do on Zoom, which might explain why banking execs are so antsy to get back to IRL office work.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Uber Agrees to Reclassify Its UK Drivers as Workers
item.description: In a first for the company, Uber said it will reclassify its 70,000+ drivers in the UK as “workers.” Seems like a minor edit, but in the world of the gig economy titles matter.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Volkswagen Outlines Plans to Beat Tesla by 2025
item.description: Big picture: Analysts see room for Tesla and Volkswagen in the growing EV market, per Bloomberg.  And with 70 new electric models on the way this decade, Volkswagen could match Tesla EV sales as soon as 2022 and outstrip it by a margin of 300,000 come 2025, UBS predicts.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Uber Agrees to Reclassify Its UK Drivers as Workers
item.description: Yesterday, Uber said it will reclassify its 70,000+ drivers in the UK as “workers.” Last month, the British Supreme Court dismissed Uber’s ruled against Uber's insistence its drivers weren't workers. We hadn’t heard much from the company until yesterday’s decision.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Why ETFs Are Exploding in Popularity
item.description: About the recent ETF boom: For years ETFs have been one of the most disruptive forces in investing, and they're only gaining steam based on the hopes of an explosive, vaccine-fueled economic recovery. Q from Andrew: Why have I seen so many new ETFs pop up recently? The first ETF launched in the US in 1993.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: March 17
item.description: (Vice) Read: A hacker got all my texts for $16. 13 EU countries have suspended the shot due to concerns over reported blood clots.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Volkswagen Outlines Plans to Beat Tesla by 2025
item.description: Big picture: Analysts see room for Tesla and Volkswagen in the growing EV market, per Bloomberg.  And with 70 new electric models on the way this decade, Volkswagen could match Tesla EV sales as soon as 2022 and outstrip it by a margin of 300,000 come 2025, UBS predicts.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: If You Work in Finance, You Might Be Back in the Office Soon
item.description: Less than half of Manhattan's 1 million office employees are expected to return to the office by September, per the Partnership for New York City.  Then yesterday, we learned that JPMorgan is planning for summer interns in New York and London to work in-person, according to the NYT.
item.author: Eliza Carter

item.title: Architects Win Pritzker Prize for Work on Public Housing
item.description: Bottom line: "If we observe carefully, if we look at things with fresh eyes, there is always something positive to take from an existing situation," Lacaton said. We'd challenge them to bring that energy to the FBI headquarters in DC.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Believe It or Not, Bitcoin Could Be Better Than Gold
item.description: Bitcoin is... A Bit of Bitcoin BasicsYou could think of Bitcoin as magic internet money—and yes, we at Morning Brew are known for our technical economics vocabulary.  Think GoldThe best case scenario for Bitcoin probably looks something like the consistent historical value of gold. What’s super cool is that, even if the hype fades, Bitcoin may actually more likely become ensconced in our society as a thing that stores value. Its Place in Your PortfolioBitcoin has a way to go when it comes to being taken seriously by institutions and governments.  The Invisible Potential of BitcoinYou can’t see Bitcoin. File under: The best tax help around. *Bitcoin has the potential to become the digital version of gold. While gold was once traded as a physical currency, its value in the stock market is no longer tied to its industrial value. Plenty of smart people think it’s a good move to invest in Bitcoin.
item.author: Morning Brew

item.title: The UK Updates Their Inflation Basket To Reflect New Consumer Habits
item.description: Bottom line: In total, 17 items were added to the basket while 10 items, including gold chains, canteen sandwiches, and Axminster carpets, were dropped.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: March 16
item.description: ) its CEO and CFO to esteemed new positions, though to the relief of many Tesla investors, they'll also keep their previous titles.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: ViacomCBS and Discovery Are Quietly Having Incredible Years
item.description: Since launching in December, Discovery+ has attracted more than 11 million subscribers, while Paramount+, ViacomCBS's streaming service, is believed to have around 8–9 million subscribers.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Germany, Italy Join Neighbors in Suspending AstraZeneca Vaccine
item.description: Yesterday, Germany, France, and Italy joined several of their neighbors in suspending AstraZeneca's two-shot Covid vaccine following reports of blood clots. Over half of Italy's population is back under strict lockdowns. Indonesia and the Democratic Republic of the Congo also suspended rollout.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Biden Expected to Propose First Major Tax Hike Since 1993
item.description: And the Tax Foundation estimates that some of the proposed changes to corporate taxes would reduce US GDP by 0.8% and wages by 0.7% in the long run.    When Trump slashed the corporate rate to 21% in 2017, he wasn't the first to bat for business interests. Bumping the income tax to 39.6% for those earning $400,000+  Taxing capital gains like normal income if you earn $1+ millionIncreasing estate taxes to 45% for assets worth $1+ millionSo, if you still clip coupons, don't expect any changes. These increases largely follow Biden's campaign proposals to only tax high-earners.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: The UK Updates Their Inflation Basket To Reflect New Consumer Habits

item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: Biden Expected to Propose First Major Tax Hike Since 1993
item.description: And the Tax Foundation estimates that some of the proposed changes to corporate taxes would reduce US GDP by 0.8% and wages by 0.7% in the long run.    When Trump slashed the corporate rate to 21% in 2017, he wasn't the first to bat for business interests. Bumping the income tax to 39.6% for those earning $400,000+  Taxing capital gains like normal income if you earn $1+ millionIncreasing estate taxes to 45% for assets worth $1+ millionSo, if you still clip coupons, don't expect any changes. These increases largely follow Biden's campaign proposals to only tax high-earners.

item.title: ViacomCBS and Discovery Are Quietly Having Incredible Years
item.description: But while the biggest players have gobbled up hundreds of millions of subscribers... Since the start of 2021, ViacomCBS stock is up +156% and Discovery has gained +141%, powered by the launches of their respective streaming services, Paramount+ and Discovery+.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: The Week Ahead
item.description: Everything else:St. Patrick's Day is on Wednesday. As you can see above, Chicago is ready to celebrate. Here's the bracket. The entire tournament is taking place in Indiana this year. For best picture, Nomadland, The Trial of the Chicago 7, Promising Young Woman, Minari, and Mank appear to be locks.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: March 15
item.description: (Kiplinger) Here's a mathematical answer. Read: How much bitcoin should you own?
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Grammys Pay Tribute to Local Music Venues
item.description: The ceremony also paid tribute to independent music venues hurt by the pandemic, featuring bartenders, box-office managers, and other industry workers from iconic venues like Nashville's Station Inn and NYC's Apollo Theater.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: Stimulus Checks Begin Arriving
item.description: + If you're eligible, use the IRS's Get My Payment tool to see when your check is coming. The IRS told H&R Block that most eligible Americans will receive theirs on Wednesday.
item.author: Alex Hickey

item.title: NFTs, Bitcoin, SPACs, Snakers: Too Many Crazes to Count
item.description: A short listCrypto: Last March, bitcoin was hovering just above $5,000; on Saturday, it hit an all-time high above $61,000. The amount wagered on SPACs to fall in value has tripled since the start of the year, per the WSJ. Zoom out: No one knows exactly if/when any of these "mini-bubbles'' will pop but, at least in the SPAC world, some think it might be soon. Even NFTs were being developed as early as 2017. SPACs have been around for decades, sneaker-flipping dates back to 1985, and trading cards, well…you get the point. Plus, it’s not like any of the "crazes" described above are that new.
item.author: Neal Freyman
